intro: Vitex luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon chaste tree, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, often blooming in the summer months. Vitex luzonica is typically found in moist, shaded areas of mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture and landscape design.
